newsitem.title: USA: Acclaim sees profit by fiscal Q1.
newsitem.headline: Acclaim sees profit by fiscal Q1.

text.p: Acclaim Entertainment Inc said on Wednesday that initial shipments of its "Turok: Dinosaur Hunter" video game are exceeding expectations, which could help return the company to profitability by December.

Kathryn Morris, Acclaim's senior manager of public relations, said the game for Nintendo Co Ltd's N64 video game system, which was introduced March 4, 1997, and other new video game titles are expected to make the company profitable for the fiscal first quarter ended November 30, 1997.
Acclaim declined to release any sales figures on Turok, but the company said reorders for the title are coming in at a brisk pace.
Acclaim is planning on narrowing its losses through its fourth quarter ended September 30, 1997.
